<<<<<<< HEAD
The antimoniall cup twice cast: or a treatise concerning the antimoniall cup, shewing the abuse thereof. First, written in Latine by Iames Primrose Dr. of physicke, in consideration of a small pamphlet set forth by the founder of the cup. Translated into English by Robert Wittie, Master of Arts, Philiatr De calice ex antimonio sive stibio. English Primerose, James, ca. 1598-1659. Wittie, Robert, 1613?-1684.
[4], 34, [i.e. 30], [2] p.
Printed by B. A[lsop] and T. Favvcet, London : 1640.
A translation of "De calice ex antimonio sive stibio", which was printed as part of Book 4 of Primerose's "De vulgi erroribus", 1658. Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: Of the antimoniall cup. Page numbers 13-16 omitted from pagination. With a final imprimatur leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
